events.message: Customer reported a car accident that occurred on the highway involving two vehicles on April 30th. The initial details were submitted for opening the claim.
The claim was correctly categorized under Auto Accident based on the keywords in the customer’s report mentioning vehicle collision and damage.
An agent with expertise in auto claims was assigned to ensure thorough handling of the collision and vehicle repair aspects of the case.
Customer was notified that the claim has been acknowledged and is now under review. They expressed relief to receive the confirmation promptly.
Request was sent to the customer for the vehicle repair estimate, police accident report, and photographs of the damages as supporting documents.
Customer submitted all requested documents including repair quotes, photos of the damaged vehicle, and a copy of the police report as requested.
An investigation was initiated to verify the details of the collision and assess the extent of vehicle damage reported by the customer.
Investigation concluded confirming the collision circumstances and validating submitted repair estimates were appropriate and necessary.
A settlement offer was prepared and sent to the customer covering vehicle repair costs and other compensations as per policy terms.
Customer responded expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement and the speed with which their claim was processed.
The claim was formally approved by management, confirming that terms of the settlement met all policy guidelines and approvals.
Payment was issued to the customer’s bank account covering the settlement amount for the vehicle repair and associated costs.
The claim was officially closed in the system after final payment and confirmation that customer had no further questions or disputes.
All claim documents and correspondence were archived for record-keeping in accordance with company policy and regulatory guidelines.
